intro: Paramignya hispida, commonly known as the rough paramignya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, round berries. Paramignya hispida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
